ContactPersonPrimary.ContactOrganization: Government of Canada; Natural Resources Canada; Earth Sciences Sector; Canada Centre for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO)

Layer.Name: canvec
Layer.Title: Canvec
Layer.Abstract: Web Map Service (WMS) Canvec.

Layer.Name: land
Layer.Title: All Land Features
Layer.Abstract: Land Features entities are: Island, Shoreline, Wooded Area, Saturated soil, Landform Feature (esker, sandâ€¦), and Cut Line. CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format, and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative, and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).

Layer.Name: woodedarea_50k
Layer.Title: Wooded Area, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area covered by trees or shrubs having a minimum height of 2 metres.

Layer.Name: landform_feature_polygon_50k
Layer.Title: Landform Feature, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Characteristic landform produced naturally or in some cases, artificially and recognizable on the ground. This includes forms such as eskers, moraines, tundra polygons, embankments, etc.

Layer.Name: saturated_soil_50k
Layer.Title: Saturated Soil, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Water saturated area where there is no drainage.

Layer.Name: shoreline_50k
Layer.Title: Shoreline, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Delineation of a waterbody. It generally represents the boundary between water and land, but also serves as the virtual demarcation between the sea and inland waters (tributaries).

Layer.Name: landform_feature_line_50k
Layer.Title: Landform Feature, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Characteristic landform produced naturally or in some cases, artificially and recognizable on the ground. This includes forms such as eskers, moraines, tundra polygons, embankments, etc.

Layer.Name: landform_feature_point_50k
Layer.Title: Landform Feature, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Characteristic landform produced naturally or in some cases, artificially and recognizable on the ground. This includes forms such as eskers, moraines, tundra polygons, embankments, etc.

Layer.Name: shoreline_small
Layer.Title: Shoreline, 35M-13M, line
Layer.Abstract: Delineation of a waterbody. It generally represents the boundary between water and land, but also serves as the virtual demarcation between the sea and inland waters (tributaries).

Layer.Name: island_mid
Layer.Title: Island, 13M-3M, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Simple polygon feature defined by a single outer ring describing a land area surrounded by water.

Layer.Name: shoreline_mid
Layer.Title: Shoreline, 13M-3M, line
Layer.Abstract: Delineation of a waterbody. It generally represents the boundary between water and land, but also serves as the virtual demarcation between the sea and inland waters (tributaries).

Layer.Name: island_large_01
Layer.Title: Island, 3M-500K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Simple polygon feature defined by a single outer ring describing a land area surrounded by water.

Layer.Name: shoreline_large
Layer.Title: Shoreline, 3000K-500K, line
Layer.Abstract: Delineation of a waterbody. It generally represents the boundary between water and land, but also serves as the virtual demarcation between the sea and inland waters (tributaries).

Layer.Name: wooded_area_250k
Layer.Title: Wooded Area, 400K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area covered by trees or shrubs having a minimum height of 2 metres.

Layer.Name: island_large_02
Layer.Title: Island, 500K-275K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Simple polygon feature defined by a single outer ring describing a land area surrounded by water.

Layer.Name: landform_feature_polygon_250k
Layer.Title: Landform Feature, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Characteristic landform produced naturally or in some cases, artificially and recognizable on the ground. This includes forms such as eskers, moraines, tundra polygons, embankments, etc.

Layer.Name: saturated_soil_250k
Layer.Title: Saturated Soil, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Water saturated area where there is no drainage.

Layer.Name: shoreline_250k
Layer.Title: Shoreline, 500K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: Delineation of a waterbody. It generally represents the boundary between water and land, but also serves as the virtual demarcation between the sea and inland waters (tributaries).

Layer.Name: landform_feature_line_250k
Layer.Title: Landform Feature, 250K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: Characteristic landform produced naturally or in some cases, artificially and recognizable on the ground. This includes forms such as eskers, moraines, tundra polygons, embankments, etc.

Layer.Name: landform_feature_point_250k
Layer.Title: Landform Feature, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: Characteristic landform produced naturally or in some cases, artificially and recognizable on the ground. This includes forms such as eskers, moraines, tundra polygons, embankments, etc.

Layer.Name: hydro
Layer.Title: All Hydro Features
Layer.Abstract: Hydro Features is composed of the network of Canadian surface waters. Hydro Features entities are: Watercourse, Water Linear Flow, Hydro Obstacle (falls, rapidsâ€¦), Waterbody (lake, watercourseâ€¦), Permanent Snow and Ice, Water Well, and Spring. CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format, and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative, and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).

Layer.Name: snow_and_ice_50k
Layer.Title: Permanent Snow and Ice, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Permanent snow and ice such a glacier, ice cap or ice field.

Layer.Name: waterbody_50k
Layer.Title: Waterbody, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Polygon feature describing a body of water.

Layer.Name: hydro_obstacle_polygon_50k
Layer.Title: Hydro Obstacle, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Feature representing an obstacle that disturbs or impedes the natural flow of surface water

Layer.Name: watercourse_50k
Layer.Title: Watercourse, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: A natural body of water through which water may flow.

Layer.Name: hydro_obstacle_line_50k
Layer.Title: Hydro Obstacle, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Feature representing an obstacle that disturbs or impedes the natural flow of surface water

Layer.Name: hydro_obstacle_point_50k
Layer.Title: Hydro Obstacle, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Feature representing an obstacle that disturbs or impedes the natural flow of surface water

Layer.Name: water_well_50k
Layer.Title: Water Well, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A narrow, deep hole dug or drilled into the ground down to the water table to supply high-flow water to a municipality or an arid area.

Layer.Title: Waterbody, 60M-13M, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Polygon feature describing a body of water.

Layer.Abstract: A natural body of water through which water may flow.

Layer.Abstract: Permanent snow and ice such a glacier, ice cap or ice field.

Layer.Title: Waterbody, 3M-500K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Polygon feature describing a body of water.

Layer.Title: Waterbody, 3M-500K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Polygon feature describing a body of water.

Layer.Title: Watercourse, 3M-500K, line
Layer.Abstract: A natural body of water through which water may flow.

Layer.Name: snow_and_ice_250k
Layer.Title: Permanent Snow and Ice, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Permanent snow and ice such a glacier, ice cap or ice field.

Layer.Name: waterbody_250k
Layer.Title: Waterbody, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Polygon feature describing a body of water.

Layer.Title: Hydro Obstacle, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Feature representing an obstacle that disturbs or impedes the natural flow of surface water

Layer.Name: man_made
Layer.Title: All Man-Made Features
Layer.Abstract: Man-Made Features entities are: Dam, Protection Structure (breakwater, dike/levee), Liquid Storage Facility (basin, swimming poolâ€¦), Tank, Building, Delimiting Structure (fence, wallâ€¦), Landmark Feature (cross, radar, crane, fortâ€¦), Chimney, Tower, Sewage Pipeline, Conduit Bridge, Waste, Leisure Area, Residential Area, Commercial, and Institutional Area and Ritual Cultural Area (shrine, cemeteryâ€¦). CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format, and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative, and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).

Layer.Name: residentialarea_50k
Layer.Title: Residential Area, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped for residential and light commercial or industrial activities.

Layer.Name: waste_50k
Layer.Title: Waste, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped for heavy waste and residuals management activities, including autowrecker

Layer.Name: landmark_feature_50k
Layer.Title: Landmark Feature, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Manmade feature whose configuration or height makes it a landmark on the field.

Layer.Name: cemetery_50k
Layer.Title: Cemetery, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Site where the remains of people are buried.

Layer.Name: zoo_annot_50k
Layer.Title: Zoo, 50K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: An area where animals are kept for display or study.

Layer.Name: commercial_institution_area_50k
Layer.Title: Commercial and Institutional Area, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped for commercial, institutional, or light industrial activities

Layer.Name: tank_50k
Layer.Title: Tank, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: A cylindrical structure used to store liquids.

Layer.Name: leisure_area_polygon_50k
Layer.Title: Leisure Area, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped and organised for recreational or sporting activities

Layer.Name: dam_polygon_50k
Layer.Title: Dam, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Manmade structure built across a body of water to control the water flow.

Layer.Name: dam_line_50k
Layer.Title: Dam, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Manmade structure built across a body of water to control the water flow.

Layer.Name: protection_structure_line_50k
Layer.Title: Protection Structure, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Structure or embankment generally built to protect people or infrastructures. It can be a breakwater, dike, levee, wall, etc.

Layer.Name: building_50k
Layer.Title: Building, 50K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Permanent walled and roofed construction.

Layer.Name: building_point_50k
Layer.Title: Building, 50K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Permanent walled and roofed construction.

Layer.Name: landmark_feature_point_50k
Layer.Title: Landmark Feature, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Manmade feature whose configuration or height makes it a landmark on the field.

Layer.Name: chimney_50k
Layer.Title: Chimney, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: An upright flue through which combustion gases and smoke are discharged high into the air.

Layer.Name: tower_50k
Layer.Title: Tower, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A structure of 10 meters or more built to provide clearance above the surrounding objects or features.

Layer.Name: waste_point_50k
Layer.Title: Waste, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped for heavy waste and residuals management activities, including autowrecker

Layer.Name: leisure_area_point_50k
Layer.Title: Leisure Area, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped and organised for recreational or sporting activities

Layer.Name: ritual_cultural_area_point_50k
Layer.Title: Ritual Cultural Area, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site or area whose historical, cultural or religious nature is of interest.

Layer.Name: residentialarea_250k_01
Layer.Title: Residential Area, 2M-500K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped for residential and light commercial or industrial activities.

Layer.Name: dam_large
Layer.Title: Dam, 1M-500K, point
Layer.Abstract: Manmade structure built across a body of water to control the water flow.

Layer.Name: residentialarea_250k_02
Layer.Title: Residential Area, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped for residential and light commercial or industrial activities.

Layer.Name: dam_polygon_250k
Layer.Title: Dam, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Manmade structure built across a body of water to control the water flow.

Layer.Name: liquid_storage_facility_250k
Layer.Title: Liquid Storage Facility, 200K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Artificial pond or basin used to accumulate a significant volume of water or liquid for domestic, agricultural or industrial use, including consumption, bathing and irrigation.

Layer.Name: dam_line_250k
Layer.Title: Dam, 500K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: Manmade structure built across a body of water to control the water flow.

Layer.Name: protection_structure_250k
Layer.Title: Protection Structure, 250K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: Structure or embankment generally built to protect people or infrastructures. It can be a breakwater, dike, levee, wall, etc.

Layer.Name: chimney_250k
Layer.Title: Chimney, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: An upright flue through which combustion gases and smoke are discharged high into the air.

Layer.Name: tower_250k
Layer.Title: Tower, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: A structure of 10 meters or more built to provide clearance above the surrounding objects or features.

Layer.Name: tank_250k
Layer.Title: Tank, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: A cylindrical structure used to store liquids.

Layer.Name: building_250k
Layer.Title: Building, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: Permanent walled and roofed construction.

Layer.Name: leisure_area_250k
Layer.Title: Leisure Area, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: Area landscaped and organised for recreational or sporting activities

Layer.Name: ritual_cultural_area_250k
Layer.Title: Ritual Cultural Area, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site or area whose historical, cultural or religious nature is of interest.

Layer.Name: resource_management
Layer.Title: All Resource Management Features
Layer.Abstract: Resource Management Features entities are: Power Line, Communication, Pipeline, Valve, Petroleum Well, Wind-Operated Device, Transformer Station, Ore, Aggregate, Peat and Oil, and Gas Site. CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format, and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative, and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).

Layer.Name: peat_50k
Layer.Title: Peat, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: An excavation created by the removal of peat.

Layer.Name: ore_polygon_50k
Layer.Title: Ore, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: An excavation or tunnel in the earth from which mineral substances are extracted

Layer.Name: aggregate_50k
Layer.Title: Aggregate, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Excavation created by the removal of stone (by blasting or cutting), gravel, sand, or clay

Layer.Name: oil_gas_site_50k
Layer.Title: Oil and Gas Site, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Site or area used for the extraction, transformation or distribution of oil or natural gas products.

Layer.Name: aggregate_quarry_50k
Layer.Title: Quarry, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: An excavation created by the removal of stone by blasting or cutting.

Layer.Name: transformer_station_polygon_50k
Layer.Title: Transformer Station, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: Electrical power network facilities where voltage is altered.

Layer.Name: pipeline_50k
Layer.Title: Pipeline, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: One or more cylindrical conduits used to convey liquids or gases.

Layer.Name: powerline_50k
Layer.Title: Power Line, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: One or more cables used for power transmission.

Layer.Name: communcationline_50k
Layer.Title: Communication Line, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: One or more cables used for communication purposes

Layer.Name: ore_point_50k
Layer.Title: Ore, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: An excavation or tunnel in the earth from which mineral substances are extracted

Layer.Name: transformer_station_point_50k
Layer.Title: Transformer Station, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Electrical power network facilities where voltage is altered.

Layer.Name: valve_point_50k
Layer.Title: Valve, 50K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A device on a pipeline that controls flow.

Layer.Name: wind_operated_device_50k
Layer.Title: Wind-Operated Device, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A structure used to develop power from the wind.

Layer.Name: petroleum_well_50k
Layer.Title: Petroleum Well, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A narrow, deep hole dug or drilled in the earth for the extraction of petroleum liquids or gases.

Layer.Name: gasoilfacilities_point_50k
Layer.Title: Oil and Gas Site, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site or area used for the extraction, transformation or distribution of oil or natural gas products.

Layer.Name: ore_annotation_50k
Layer.Title: Ore, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: An excavation or tunnel in the earth from which mineral substances are extracted

Layer.Title: Ore, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: An excavation or tunnel in the earth from which mineral substances are extracted

Layer.Abstract: Excavation created by the removal of stone (by blasting or cutting), gravel, sand, or clay

Layer.Title: Quarry, 500K-75K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: An excavation created by the removal of stone by blasting or cutting.

Layer.Title: Pipeline, 250K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: One or more cylindrical conduits used to convey liquids or gases.

Layer.Name: powerline_250k
Layer.Title: Power Line, 250K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: One or more cables used for power transmission.

Layer.Title: Communication Line, 250K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: One or more cables used for communication purposes

Layer.Title: Transformer Station, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: Electrical power network facilities where voltage is altered.

Layer.Abstract: A narrow, deep hole dug or drilled in the earth for the extraction of petroleum liquids or gases.

Layer.Name: ore_point_250k
Layer.Title: Ore, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: An excavation or tunnel in the earth from which mineral substances are extracted

Layer.Name: oil_gas_site_250k
Layer.Title: Oil and Gas Site, 250K-75K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site or area used for the extraction, transformation or distribution of oil or natural gas products.

Layer.Name: transport
Layer.Title: All Transport Features
Layer.Abstract: Transport Features is composed of, among others, the National Road Network (NRN) and the National Railway Network (NRWN). Transport Features entities are: Nautical Facility, Track Segment, Track Junction, Railway Station, Track Crossing, Track Marker Post, Track Structure, Rail Ferry, Road Segment, Road Ferry, Road Junction, Blocked Passage, Toll Point, Aerial Cableway, Footbridge, Trail, Navigational Aid, Marina, and Runway. CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).

Layer.Name: runway_50k
Layer.Title: Runway, 75K-1K, polygon
Layer.Abstract: A prepared surface used by airplanes and helicopters for take-off and landing.

Layer.Name: footbridge_50k
Layer.Title: Footbridge, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: A bridge for pedestrians, bicycles, and occasionally some types of light recreational vehicles. Footbridges are used for crossing major arteries (urban areas) or obstructions such as streams, rivers, and deep depressions along trails.

Layer.Name: road_segment_50k
Layer.Title: Road Segment, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: A road is a linear section of the earth designed for or the result of vehicular movement. A road segment is the specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics. The specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: road_segment_structures_50k
Layer.Title: Road Structure, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: A road is a linear section of the earth designed for or the result of vehicular movement. A road segment is the specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics. The specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: Road_ferry_50k
Layer.Title: Road Ferry, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: The average route a ferryboat takes when transporting vehicles between two fixed locations on the road network that operates either year round or through periods when ice conditions permit.

Layer.Name: track_structure_50k
Layer.Title: Track Structure, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Man-made structure or construction built to support or protect a railway track, or allow it to cross an obstacle. The structure may be built at, above, or below grade level.

Layer.Name: track_segment_50k
Layer.Title: Track Segment, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Portion of a railway track with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: trail_50k
Layer.Title: Trail, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: A narrow path or route suitable for walking, hiking, or bicycling.

Layer.Name: nautical_facility_line_50k
Layer.Title: Nautical Facility, 75K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Structure or facility made to receive, launch, land, build or repair ships and watercrafts

Layer.Name: navigationalaid_50k
Layer.Title: Navigational Aid, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A Structure erected to guide navigators

Layer.Name: runway_point_50k
Layer.Title: Runway, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: A prepared surface used by airplanes and helicopters for take-off and landing.

Layer.Name: marina_point_50k
Layer.Title: Marina, 75K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site that is equipped for mooring and servicing pleasure boats

Layer.Name: tollpoint_50k
Layer.Title: Toll Booth, 50K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Place where a right-of-way is charged to gain access to a motorway, a bridge, etc.

Layer.Name: railway_station_50k
Layer.Title: Railway Station, 50K-1K, point
Layer.Abstract: Location along a railway track identified by a station name sign and designated by that name in a time table (schedule listing the times at which certain events, such as arrivals and departures at a station, are expected to take place). A railway station does not necessarily have to be a building.

Layer.Name: railway_small
Layer.Title: Track Segment, 35M-13M, line
Layer.Abstract: Portion of a railway track with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: roads_small
Layer.Title: Road Segment, 35M-13M, line
Layer.Abstract: A road is a linear section of the earth designed for or the result of vehicular movement. A road segment is the specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics. The specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: roadferry_small
Layer.Title: Road Ferry, 15M-13M, line
Layer.Abstract: The average route a ferryboat takes when transporting vehicles between two fixed locations on the road network that operates either year round or through periods when ice conditions permit.

Layer.Name: road_ferry_mid
Layer.Title: Road Ferry, 13M-3M, line
Layer.Abstract: The average route a ferryboat takes when transporting vehicles between two fixed locations on the road network that operates either year round or through periods when ice conditions permit.

Layer.Name: road_segment_mid
Layer.Title: Road Segment, 13M-3M, line
Layer.Abstract: A road is a linear section of the earth designed for or the result of vehicular movement. A road segment is the specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics. The specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Title: Track Segment, 13M-3M, line
Layer.Abstract: Portion of a railway track with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: road_ferry_large
Layer.Title: Road Ferry, 3M-500K, line
Layer.Abstract: The average route a ferryboat takes when transporting vehicles between two fixed locations on the road network that operates either year round or through periods when ice conditions permit.

Layer.Name: road_segment_large
Layer.Title: Road Segment, 3M-500K, line
Layer.Abstract: A road is a linear section of the earth designed for or the result of vehicular movement. A road segment is the specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics. The specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: track_segment_large
Layer.Title: Track Segment, 3M-500K, line
Layer.Abstract: Portion of a railway track with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: aerodrome_large
Layer.Title: Aerodrome, 3M-500K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site used by aircrafts for take-off and landing.

Layer.Name: port_large
Layer.Title: Port, 2M-500K, point
Layer.Abstract: Site located on the sea coast or on the shore of an important lake or river, built to receive and shelter ships and boats and allow them to load and unload what they carry.

Layer.Name: roads_250k
Layer.Title: Road Segment, 500K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: A road is a linear section of the earth designed for or the result of vehicular movement. A road segment is the specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics. The specific representation of a portion of a road with uniform characteristics.

Layer.Name: road_ferry_250k
Layer.Title: Road Ferry, 500K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: The average route a ferryboat takes when transporting vehicles between two fixed locations on the road network that operates either year round or through periods when ice conditions permit.

Layer.Name: track_structure_250k
Layer.Title: Track Structure, 500K-75K, line
Layer.Abstract: Man-made structure or construction built to support or protect a railway track, or allow it to cross an obstacle. The structure may be built at, above, or below grade level.

Layer.Name: track_segment_250k

Layer.Name: elevation
Layer.Title: All Elevation Features
Layer.Abstract: Elevation Features entities are: Contour and Elevation Point. CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format, and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative, and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).

Layer.Name: contour_approximative_250k_01
Layer.Title: Contour, 75K-50K, line
Layer.Abstract: A continuous line formed of vertices located at a constant elevation from mean sea level (MSL) to describe terrain relief.

Layer.Name: contour_elevation_250k_01
Layer.Title: Contour, 75K-50K, line
Layer.Abstract: A continuous line formed of vertices located at a constant elevation from mean sea level (MSL) to describe terrain relief.

Layer.Title: Depression, 50K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: Contour representing a depression in the terrain relief where no surface drainage exists.

Layer.Name: contour_approximative_50k
Layer.Title: Contour, 50K-1K, line
Layer.Abstract: A continuous line formed of vertices located at a constant elevation from mean sea level (MSL) to describe terrain relief.

Layer.Name: toponymy
Layer.Title: Toponymic features
Layer.Abstract: Toponymic Features entity is Named Feature (geographical name or toponym). CanVec is a digital cartographic reference product of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). It originates from the best available data sources covering Canadian territory, offers quality topographical information in vector format, and complies with international geomatics standards. CanVec is a multi-source product coming mainly from the National Topographic Data Base (NTDB), the Mapping the North process conducted by the Canada Center for Mapping and Earth Observation (CCMEO), the Atlas of Canada data, the GeoBase initiative, and the data update using satellite imagery coverage (e.g. Landsat 7, Spot, Radarsat, etc.).
